errors.error_description: The primary pip installation command contains a syntax error (`--featuretools` instead of `featuretools`), which will cause the installation to fail.
correction_candidates: python -m pip install featuretools
pip install "featuretools"
python pip install featuretools
pip install -p featuretools

errors.error_description: The installation command for Dask support uses an incorrect extra identifier (`[dask-support]` instead of `[dask]`), which will fail.
correction_candidates: python -m pip install "featuretools[dask]"
python -m pip install featuretools dask
python -m pip install "featuretools[dask-complete]"
pip install featuretools-dask

errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states a requirement for an outdated Python version (3.6), which may mislead users and is not the actual requirement for the latest version.
correction_candidates: Remove the sentence 'Note: Featuretools requires Python 3.6 for full compatibility.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Featuretools requires Python 3.8 or newer.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Featuretools requires Python 2.7.'
Add a note saying 'Works with any Python 3 version.'
errors.golden_answer: Remove the sentence 'Note: Featuretools requires Python 3.6 for full compatibility.'

errors.error_description: The image URL for the entity set diagram points to a non-existent `master` branch instead of the correct `main` branch, resulting in a broken image link.
correction_candidates: https://github.com/alteryx/featuretools/blob/main/docs/source/_static/images/entity_set.png?raw=true
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alteryx/featuretools/main/docs/source/_static/images/entity_set.png
docs/source/_static/images/entity_set.png
https://github.com/alteryx/featuretools/raw/main/docs/source/_static/images/entity_set.png

errors.error_description: Reference to development dependencies in setup.py using incorrect installation syntax
correction_candidates: Change the command to python -m pip install -e .[dev] for proper editable installation
Use pip install -e . to install in development mode without extra dependencies
Replace with pip install -r dev-requirements.txt for development dependencies
Use python setup.py develop to install in development mode
errors.golden_answer: Change the command to python -m pip install -e .[dev] for proper editable installation

errors.error_description: Incorrect pip command syntax using unnecessary and potentially harmful flags
correction_candidates: Use the standard python -m pip install featuretools command without additional flags
Replace with pip install --upgrade featuretools for safer upgrade functionality
Use conda install command instead of pip for better dependency management
Add --user flag instead of --force for user-level installation
errors.golden_answer: Use the standard python -m pip install featuretools command without additional flags
